constellations.name: Cassopeia
constellations.description: Visible all year round in the northern hemisphere

constellations.name: Sagittarius
constellations.description: Best seen in August. Sagittarius is in the direction of the center of the galaxy

constellations.name: Ursa Major
constellations.nickname: Great Bear, Big Dipper, Seven Stars

constellations.name: Centaurus
constellations.description: Best seen in spring in the southern hemisphere

stars.name: Polaris (North Star)
stars.description: It’s the brightest star in Ursa Minor. Stars circle around Polaris in the northern hemisphere.

stars.name: Vega
stars.description: Brightest star in Lyra...But, actually it’s less luminous than most stars in Lyra. Vega just looks brighter because it’s closer! It makes the Summer Triangle with Deneb and Altair.

stars.name: Alpha Centauri
stars.description: Closest star to the Sun. It’s the brightest star in Centaurus. Alpha Centauri is not just one star, but three stars.

stars.name: Sirius
stars.description: aka Dog Star. It’s the brightest star in the night sky and it will continue to be the brightest for the next 210,000 years. It’s both luminous and close.

stars.name: VY Canis Majoris
stars.description: Largest known star. It’s ~1500 times the size of the Sun and also very luminous. It’s a red hypergiant star and it will explode as a hypernova any day.

stars.name: Betelgeuse
stars.description: One of the brightest stars in the night sky. It has a reddish color and irregular variability. It’s a red supergiant star and it will explode in about 100,000 years.

stars.name: Castor
stars.description: One Head of the Gemini twins. Despite the apparent closeness and friendship between them, the two stars are actually far away and moving in different directions.

stars.name: Pollux
stars.description: One Head of the Gemini twins. Despite the apparent closeness and friendship between them, the two stars are actually far away and moving in different directions.

stars.name: Deneb
stars.description: Brightest star in cygnus, also one of the most luminous near-by stars. It’s part of the Summer Triangle along with Vega and Altair.

stars.name: Altair
stars.description: Brightest star in Aquila, also one of the closest visible stars. Altair, Vega, and Deneb form the Summer Triangle.

stars.name: Sun
stars.description: Closest star to the Earth. The Sun is a medium-sized, middle-aged star at 4.6 billion years old. It’s also the only star that does not belong to a constellation. The energy the Earth receives from the Sun is much more than we consume. (But we don’t fully utilize it)
